what: Catalogue of the Timber Forest Species of the Peruvian Amazon
title: Catalogue of the Timber Forest Species of the Peruvian Amazon
text: R package, perutimber, provides easy access taxonomic information 1,300 vascular plant species found “Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga”. package based authoritative publication Vásquez Martínez Rojas Gonzáles (2022) titled “Catálogo de las especies forestales maderables de la Amazonía y la Yunga Peruana” Revista Forestal del Perú 37(3, Número Especial): 5-138. perutimber, researchers enthusiasts alike can efficiently explore analyze timber plant species.

title: Catalogue of the Timber Forest Species of the Peruvian Amazon
text: can install perutimber package CRAN using: Also can install perutimber package GitHub using following command:

title: Catalogue of the Timber Forest Species of the Peruvian Amazon
text: Check species name listed data base: perutimber::search_perutimber function can used vector species names. can pass character vector containing multiple species names argument function, check whether species names listed data. function return character vector indicating whether species name present . ’s example: perutimber::search_perutimber can used data.frame tibble. ’s example use : perutimber::get_perutimber_data() allows access information provided “Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga”, obtain information specific species, species name vector must provided input. function returns data frame containing basic information species, common scientific names.
code: library(perutimber) sps_list <- c("Pentaplaris davidsmithii",                "Quararibea wittiia",               "Sterculia tessmanni",                "Sterculia tessmannia",                "Brosimum alicastrum subsp. bolivarense",               "Brosimum alicastrum sub bolivarense",               "Poa annua") perutimber::search_perutimber(splist = sps_list) #> [1] "Present"        "P_updated_name" "P_updated_name" "P_updated_name" #> [5] "Present"        "P_updated_name" "" # base R  sps_df <- data.frame(sps_list) sps_df #>                                 sps_list #> 1               Pentaplaris davidsmithii #> 2                     Quararibea wittiia #> 3                    Sterculia tessmanni #> 4                   Sterculia tessmannia #> 5 Brosimum alicastrum subsp. bolivarense #> 6    Brosimum alicastrum sub bolivarense #> 7                              Poa annua sps_df$review <- perutimber::search_perutimber(splist = sps_list) sps_df #>                                 sps_list         review #> 1               Pentaplaris davidsmithii        Present #> 2                     Quararibea wittiia P_updated_name #> 3                    Sterculia tessmanni P_updated_name #> 4                   Sterculia tessmannia P_updated_name #> 5 Brosimum alicastrum subsp. bolivarense        Present #> 6    Brosimum alicastrum sub bolivarense P_updated_name #> 7                              Poa annua   # tidyverse - tibble  sps_tbl <- tibble::tibble(sps_list) sps_tbl |>    dplyr::mutate(review = perutimber::search_perutimber(splist = sps_list)) #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   sps_list                               review           #>   <chr>                                  <chr>            #> 1 Pentaplaris davidsmithii               "Present"        #> 2 Quararibea wittiia                     "P_updated_name" #> 3 Sterculia tessmanni                    "P_updated_name" #> 4 Sterculia tessmannia                   "P_updated_name" #> 5 Brosimum alicastrum subsp. bolivarense "Present"        #> 6 Brosimum alicastrum sub bolivarense    "P_updated_name" #> 7 Poa annua                              "" perutimber::get_perutimber_data(sps_list) #>                          names_submitted                          accepted_name #> 1               Pentaplaris davidsmithii               Pentaplaris davidsmithii #> 2                     Quararibea wittiia                      Quararibea wittii #> 3                    Sterculia tessmanni                   Sterculia tessmannii #> 4                   Sterculia tessmannia                   Sterculia tessmannii #> 5 Brosimum alicastrum subsp. bolivarense Brosimum alicastrum subsp. bolivarense #> 6    Brosimum alicastrum sub bolivarense Brosimum alicastrum subsp. bolivarense #>   accepted_name_author accepted_family #> 1      Dorr & C. Bayer       Malvaceae #> 2    K. Schum. & Ulbr.       Malvaceae #> 3              Mildbr.       Malvaceae #> 4              Mildbr.       Malvaceae #> 5  (Pittier) C.C. Berg        Moraceae #> 6  (Pittier) C.C. Berg        Moraceae #>                                          common_name accepted_name_rank habit #> 1                                       Ojoso blanco            species Árbol #> 2                        Huayhuash sapote, Sapotillo            species Árbol #> 3                                   Sapote del monte            species Árbol #> 4                                   Sapote del monte            species Árbol #> 5 Congona, Machinga, Palo leche, Rama pama, Tamamuri         subspecies Árbol #> 6 Congona, Machinga, Palo leche, Rama pama, Tamamuri         subspecies Árbol #>   plant_height_m             regions    elevation_m                        uses #> 1  25-35(-40) m.                 JU.       100-1000       con aptitud maderable #> 2       10-25 m.     LO, MD, SM, UC.        100-500       con aptitud maderable #> 3       15-25 m. AM, LO, MD, PA, UC.        100-500             madera aserrada #> 4       15-25 m. AM, LO, MD, PA, UC.        100-500             madera aserrada #> 5  20-30(-35) m.         AM, LO, MD. 100-500(-1500) maderable - madera aserrada #> 6  20-30(-35) m.         AM, LO, MD. 100-500(-1500) maderable - madera aserrada

title: The matching algorithm — .match_algorithm
text: matching algorithm

title: The matching algorithm — .match_algorithm
code: .match_algorithm(   splist_class,   max_distance,   progress_bar = FALSE,   keep_closest = TRUE,   genus_fuzzy = TRUE,   grammar_check = FALSE )

title: Get perutimber data — get_perutimber_data
text: function takes species list tries match name Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga, subseting information species. name_submitted valid name, duplicated accepted_name column, else accepted_name column display closest name given maximum distance defined max_distance

title: Get perutimber data — get_perutimber_data
Get perutimber data — get_perutimber_data
text: splist character vector specifying input taxon, element including genus specific epithet , potentially, infraspecific rank, infraspecific name author name. valid characters allowed (see base::validEnc). max_distance match comparing submitted name closest name matches species listed "Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga". distance used generalized Levenshtein distance indicates total number insertions, deletions, substitutions allowed match two names. can expressed integer fraction binomial name. example, name length 10, max_distance = 0.1, allow one change (insertion, deletion, substitution). max_distance = 2, allows two changes.

title: Get perutimber data — get_perutimber_data
text: table accepted name catalog data species.

title: Get perutimber data — get_perutimber_data
code: splist <- c("Euterpe precatoria var. precatorio",             "Welfia alfredi",             "Hibiscus abelmoschus var. betulifolius") get_perutimber_data(splist) #>                      names_submitted                      accepted_name #> 1 Euterpe precatoria var. precatorio Euterpe precatoria var. precatoria #> 2                     Welfia alfredi                    Welfia alfredii #>    accepted_name_author accepted_family         common_name accepted_name_rank #> 1                             Arecaceae Huasaí, Saké, Tsáke            variety #> 2 A.J. Hend. & Villalba       Arecaceae              Camona            species #>           habit plant_height_m             regions     elevation_m #> 1 Palma arbórea   8-18(-25) m. AM, LO, MD, PA, SM. 100-1000(-2000) #> 2 Palma arbórea  10-20(-25) m.                 PA.       1400-1700 #>                    uses #> 1       madera aserrada #> 2 con aptitud maderable

what: List of Plant Species Name and information from the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — perutimber_data
title: List of Plant Species Name and information from the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — perutimber_data
text: 'perutimber_dat' contains information Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga.

title: List of Plant Species Name and information from the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — perutimber_data
List of Plant Species Name and information from the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — perutimber_data
text: tibble following columns: accepted_name_author character vector. corresponding author name accepted_name, staying empty taxonomic_status "Synonym" "opinion". accepted_family character vector. corresponding family name accepted_name. common_name character vector. Listed common names species. accepted_name_rank character vector. Information infraspecific status. habit character vector. plant_height_m character vector. plant height range meters. regions character vector. elevation character vector. uses character vector.

title: List of Plant Species Name and information from the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — perutimber_data
code: data(perutimber_data) str(perutimber_data) #> 'data.frame':	1339 obs. of  10 variables: #>  $ accepted_name       : chr  "Abarema acreana" "Abarema adenophora" "Abarema auriculata" "Abarema jupunba" ... #>  $ accepted_name_author: chr  "(J.F. Macbr.) L. Rico" "(Ducke) Barneby & J.W. Grimes" "(Benth.) Barneby & J.W. Grimes" "(Willd.) Britton & Killip" ... #>  $ accepted_family     : chr  "Fabaceae" "Fabaceae" "Fabaceae" "Fabaceae" ... #>  $ common_name         : chr  "Pashaco blanco" "No registra" "No registra" "Chunkámachari, Kuúp, Pashaquilla amarilla" ... #>  $ accepted_name_rank  : chr  "species" "species" "species" "species" ... #>  $ habit               : chr  "Árbol" "Árbol" "Árbol" "Árbol" ... #>  $ plant_height_m      : chr  "30-35(-45) m." "(10-) 20-30 m." "25-35(-40) m." "20-30 m." ... #>  $ regions             : chr  "LO." "AM, LO, PA." "LO." "AM, JU, LO, MD, PA, PU, SM." ... #>  $ elevation_m         : chr  "100-500" "100-500" "100-500" "100-1000(-1500)" ... #>  $ uses                : chr  "madera aserrada" "con aptitud maderable" "con aptitud maderable" "madera aserrada" ...

what: Search species name present in the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga — search_perutimber
title: Search species name present in the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga — search_perutimber
text: function takes species list tries match name Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga, checking name listed tha dataset.

title: Search species name present in the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga — search_perutimber
Search species name present in the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga — search_perutimber
text: splist character vector specifying input taxon, element including genus specific epithet , potentially, infraspecific rank, infraspecific name author name. valid characters allowed (see base::validEnc). max_distance match comparing submitted name closest name matches species listed "Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga". distance used generalized Levenshtein distance indicates total number insertions, deletions, substitutions allowed match two names. can expressed integer fraction binomial name. example, name length 10, max_distance = 0.1, allow one change (insertion, deletion, substitution). max_distance = 2, allows two changes.

title: Search species name present in the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga — search_perutimber
text: character vector can three different output values. first value, "Present," indicates whether species name fully matched names listed 'Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga'. second value, "P_updated_name," provides fuzzy matching species names. species name listed catalogue, third value returned empty string.

title: Search species name present in the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga — search_perutimber
code: # Search for multiple species vector splist <- c("Euterpe precatoria var. precatorio",             "Welfia alfredi",             "Hibiscus abelmoschus var. betulifolius") get_perutimber_data(splist) #>                      names_submitted                      accepted_name #> 1 Euterpe precatoria var. precatorio Euterpe precatoria var. precatoria #> 2                     Welfia alfredi                    Welfia alfredii #>    accepted_name_author accepted_family         common_name accepted_name_rank #> 1                             Arecaceae Huasaí, Saké, Tsáke            variety #> 2 A.J. Hend. & Villalba       Arecaceae              Camona            species #>           habit plant_height_m             regions     elevation_m #> 1 Palma arbórea   8-18(-25) m. AM, LO, MD, PA, SM. 100-1000(-2000) #> 2 Palma arbórea  10-20(-25) m.                 PA.       1400-1700 #>                    uses #> 1       madera aserrada #> 2 con aptitud maderable  # Search for multiple species data.frame # base df_splist <- data.frame(splist = splist) df_splist$peutimber <- search_perutimber(df_splist$splist)

what: Search plant names according to the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — search_pt
title: Search plant names according to the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — search_pt
text: Allow plant search plant taxa names listed "Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga". Connects data listed catalog validates  species present, removing orthographic errors plant names.

title: Search plant names according to the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — search_pt
code: search_pt(   splist,   max_distance = 0.2,   show_correct = FALSE,   genus_fuzzy = FALSE,   grammar_check = FALSE,   progress_bar = FALSE )

title: Search plant names according to the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — search_pt
text: splist character vector specifying input taxon, element including genus specific epithet , potentially, infraspecific rank, infraspecific name author name. valid characters allowed (see base::validEnc). max_distance match comparing submitted name closest name matches species listed "Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga". distance used generalized Levenshtein distance indicates total number insertions, deletions, substitutions allowed match two names. can expressed integer fraction binomial name. example, name length 10, max_distance = 0.1, allow one change (insertion, deletion, substitution). max_distance = 2, allows two changes. show_correct TRUE, column added final result indicating whether binomial name exactly matched (TRUE), misspelled (FALSE).

title: Search plant names according to the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — search_pt
text: data frame See perutimber::tab_perutimber details.

title: Search plant names according to the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — search_pt
text: function tries match names "Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga", corresponding accepted valid name (accepted_name). input name valid name, duplicated accepted_name column. algorithm first try exactly match binomial names provided splist. match found, try find closest name given maximum distance defined max_distance. Note binomial names valid characters allowed function.

title: Search plant names according to the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — search_pt
text: Vásquez Martínez Rojas Gonzáles (2022) titled "Catálogo de las especies forestales maderables de la Amazonía y la Yunga Peruana" Revista Forestal del Perú 37(3, Número Especial): 5-138 https://revistas.lamolina.edu.pe/index.php/rfp/article/view/1956.

what: List of Plant Species Name accordingly with the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — tab_perutimber
title: List of Plant Species Name accordingly with the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — tab_perutimber
text: 'tab_perutimber' contains records belonging timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga.

title: List of Plant Species Name accordingly with the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — tab_perutimber
List of Plant Species Name accordingly with the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — tab_perutimber
text: tibble following columns: input_genus character vector. input genus corresponding species name listed CTSAPY. input_epitheton character vector. specific epithet corresponding species name listed CTSAPY. rank character vector. taxonomic rank: "species","subspecies", "variety", corresponding species name listed CTSAPY. input_subspecies_epitheton character vector. indicated rank species, subspecies epithet input corresponding species name listed CTSAPY. taxonomic_status character vector. description taxon classified ‘accepted’, ‘synonym’, ‘opinion’. According Taxonomic Name Resolution Service - TNRS. accepted_name character vector. list accepted plant taxa names according Taxonomic Name Resolution Service - TNRS. accepted_family character vector. corresponding family name accepted_name. accepted_name_author character vector. corresponding author name accepted_name, staying empty taxonomic_status "Synonym" "opinion". tnrs_name_id character vector. accepted_name_id according Taxonomic Name Resolution Service - TNRS output. accepted_name_url character vector. accepted_name information url. source character vector. accepted_name information source.

title: List of Plant Species Name accordingly with the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — tab_perutimber
text: Catalogue timber forest species Amazon Peruvian Yunga. Boyle, B. L., Matasci, N., Mozzherin, D., Rees, T., Barbosa, G. C., Kumar Sajja, R., & Enquist, B. J. (2021). Taxonomic Name Resolution Service, version 5.0. Botanical Information Ecology Network. https://tnrs.biendata.org/ , Accessed Mar 21, 2023.

title: List of Plant Species Name accordingly with the Catalogue of the timber forest species of the Amazon and the Peruvian Yunga. — tab_perutimber
code: data(tab_perutimber) str(tab_perutimber) #> 'data.frame':	1343 obs. of  12 variables: #>  $ id_cat                    : chr  "1LIPA" "2SASP" "3ALVE" "4ANGI" ... #>  $ input_genus               : chr  "Lindackeria" "Saurauia" "Alzatea" "Anacardium" ... #>  $ input_epitheton           : chr  "paludosa" "spectabilis" "verticillata" "giganteum" ... #>  $ rank                      : chr  "species" "species" "subspecies" "species" ... #>  $ input_subspecies_epitheton: chr  "null" "null" "verticillata" "null" ... #>  $ taxonomic_status          : chr  "Accepted" "Accepted" "Accepted" "Accepted" ... #>  $ accepted_name             : chr  "Lindackeria paludosa" "Saurauia spectabilis" "Alzatea verticillata subsp. verticillata" "Anacardium giganteum" ... #>  $ accepted_family           : chr  "Achariaceae" "Actinidiaceae" "Alzateaceae" "Anacardiaceae" ... #>  $ accepted_name_author      : chr  "(Benth.) Gilg" "Hook." "null" "W. Hancock ex Engl." ... #>  $ tnrs_name_id              : chr  "255690" "4951" "9073" "13175" ... #>  $ accepted_name_url         : chr  "http://www.tropicos.org/Name/13200675" "http://www.tropicos.org/Name/500185" "http://www.tropicos.org/Name/1000003" "http://www.tropicos.org/Name/1300075" ... #>  $ source                    : chr  "tropicos" "tropicos" "tropicos" "tropicos" ...

what: List of the number positions of the first 3 letters of the species name in the tab_perutimber — tab_perutimber_position
title: List of the number positions of the first 3 letters of the species name in the tab_perutimber — tab_perutimber_position
text: 'tab_perutimber_position' reports position (term number rows) first three letters (triphthong) plant names stored variable 'accepted_name' table 'tab_perutimber'. indexing system speeds search largest list using package.

title: List of the number positions of the first 3 letters of the species name in the tab_perutimber — tab_perutimber_position
List of the number positions of the first 3 letters of the species name in the tab_perutimber — tab_perutimber_position
text: data frame 399 observations following 3 variables. position character vector. position first 3 letters species name tab_perutimber. triphthong character vector. First 3 letters species name tab_perutimber. genus character vector. Corresponding Genus name.

title: List of the number positions of the first 3 letters of the species name in the tab_perutimber — tab_perutimber_position
code: data(tab_perutimber_position) str(tab_perutimber_position) #> 'data.frame':	399 obs. of  3 variables: #>  $ position  : int  1 2 3 4 6 7 8 9 13 19 ... #>  $ triphthong: chr  "LIN" "SAU" "ALZ" "ANA" ... #>  $ genus     : chr  "LINDACKERIA" "SAURAUIA" "ALZATEA" "ANACARDIUM" ...
